title: Gene Munster: Tesla About to go Vertical
transcript: Hello you animals. Today I have a few juicy clips for you. First, Gene Monster breaks down Tesla's Q4 results. Then Dan Ives makes the case that the AI spending wave is still accelerating and rippling into sectors you wouldn't expect. It's a really good mix of clips today. Check it out. >> I'll start with the pressure point which was any key updates on autonomy. And the first thing was this new metric they're giving out which is FSD subscriptions. And as someone who was a longtime analyst and now for the past decade been an investor in tech is that uh when companies take away and give metrics it's a read in terms of their confidence in the metric and so now they're giving this metric out for the first time uh those are up 30% year-over-year that would be the FS excuse me 38% year-over-year that's the number of FSD subscriptions and that outpaced the growth of the cumulative uh installed base of vehicles which is up about 20%. And so we had the subscriptions growing faster than the base which is a sign that the adoption is starting to uh quicken. That is to me probably the most important part because from that uh flows what happens with robo taxi and then to a lesser extent what happens with optimist. But that to me was the pressure point. the fact that they are now giving away FSD subscription metrics which might seem again a little bit underwhelming but I want to dive a little bit more into that FSD is making I think more progress than most people realize and yes we see it in that 38% subscription growth but just my own personal experience is that it has made a remarkable improvement uh over the last three six months and Elon on the call was asked when it's going to be 100% and he still used the word paranoid and used the word cautious and wouldn't give any timing on when he thought he would get there. But I think the substance of this is that my own experience and I think for those of you who have experienced the most recent version, you would agree that it is quite remarkable and I think the market doesn't fully understand that piece. So, we're getting closer to a point where people are going to increasingly value what's going on with FSD. There's a little bit of a nuance to the changes as they get rid of the upfront 8,000 and go go to a $99 a month in terms of how that impacts margins. I just want to quickly uh talk about that. The stock pulled back a little bit, a couple percent on that update, but effectively since they're not going to be recognizing a chunk, it's usually like 3,000 initially. It's just going to be the $99 of high margin business. It it does impact the overall margins. By my estimate, it would take the automotive gross margins X credits from 17.9% what they just reported down to 16, just to give you some context about the impact on margins. But overall, FSD continues to move forward. And the fact that they're showing us those numbers now, I think is evidence of they think this metric is going to show well in the future. Second update related to autonomy is on the robo taxi fleet. They talked about the middle of this year having adding seven new cities. They had talked about 8 to 10 total cities which would mean adding six to eight throughout calendar 26, but now they're going to do that in the first half of the year.
